posts.name: Jacob
posts.cooked:
Hello, Today I turned on my team’s access point radio today for the first time in a while to try and wirelessly connect and drive our robot. The only lights that turn on for the access point are the Power and System Status lights which are both solid. No other lights are on. I checked on our robot radio and all lights are solid except for the 2.4GHz light which is not on at all.

When I connect via ethernet to the access point, I am able to view the dashboard at http://192.168.69.1/ . When I connect via ethernet to the robot radio with the same laptop and same Ethernet cord, the dashboard does not load. The light next to the DS port blinks and I can see that it is connected in the network connections tab.

Does anyone have any ideas as to how I can get to the dashboard?

posts.name: Derek S-B
posts.cooked: With the robot radio, if not configured, the config page should be accessible at http://10.0.1.1/ but if it’s configured, the page should be accessible at http://10.XX.YY.1/ where XXYY is your team number. I’ve found the static IP to work even when wired. The dynamic IP only works for me when the radio isn’t configured. For the 2.4GHz access point to turn on DIP switch 3 needs to be turned on.

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked:
At the bottom of the config page or /status page what version firmware do you have loaded to the access point?

Is it safe to assume that’s the same firmware version on the robot radio?

Both should be upgraded to 1.2.9 or later to mitigate memory corruption. Please report back screenshots of the AP firmware.

posts.name: Jacob
posts.cooked:
I tried going to at http://10.69.25.1/ but it also did not work I’ll try to access http://10.0.1.1/ as soon as I get access to the robot again and let you know if that one works.

Edit for this: http://10.0.1.1/ is unreachable

posts.name: Jacob
posts.cooked: Both firmware versions were the same previously since I set them up at the same time (I believe it was 1.2.8), but I was trying to update them today to 1.3.0. I successfully updated the Access Point, but was unable to update the Robot Radio since it will not connect even via ethernet.

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked:
Maybe next go around try using the vivid-hosting radio network tool .

That or open a command prompt when connected to the robot radio and use the command

Arp -a

That should output the network table of devices your computer sees on which network interface and let you know the IP of the radio.

Or a program like angey-ip-scanner or Wireshark to scan all IPs looking for responses.

posts.name: Jacob
posts.cooked:
The tool says configuration failed. It is plugged into the DS port and the light is flashing.

When I use the arp -a command, this is the output

I also used the angry ip scanner here to try and scan 192.168.69.1, but it said inaccessible.

I also scanned from 10.69.25.0 to 10.69.25.255 and this is the results These two IPs were pinged, all the others were inaccessible. When I try both in the browser, neither work

posts.name: Joseph Walters
posts.cooked:
The arp-a output is interesting, you dont see the radio, nor the roborio I presume is connected or any other devices (something at .255…maybe…)

Just so you know the 10.69.25.5 is yourself - you can see that in the arp-a command (Interface: 10.69.25.5 — 0x9)

This appears to be a static address set on your ethernet port…can you go to the ethernet settings on your computer and set it from “Manual” to “Automatic” or DHCP? The radio will then attempt to give you an IP address. You can repeat the arp-a command and/or angry-ip scanner to search for connected devices after reconfiguring your port to DHCP and disconnecting and reconnecting the ethernet cable between the computer and radio (to cause a handshake to occur).

If you do this troubleshooting step please post screenshots like your previous post - those are great and help everyone else following along.

After that, I think you are at the point its time to engage Customer Support .

If your robot radio lights are on in some pattern, and the activity light on the port is blinking, and your connected with the same PC and ethernet cable that you successfully tethered to the access point with - I think your case needs more specialized assistance.

posts.name: Jacob
posts.cooked:
I contacted support and they said that the issue is that it is getting stuck on bootloader. They sent us a return label and said they need to fix it in their office, then they will send it back to us.

Thank you so much  for your help!

Also a tip for anyone contacting their support via email: if you’re sending them an email before they open/after they close, don’t send it right then. Instead schedule your email to send about 30 minutes after they open. They seem to not respond (I think it must get buried) if you send it before they open or after they close.
